meeting_request.purpose: Need help improving grades and understanding material
meeting_request.description: Hi, I'm Sabrina, a third-year chemistry major. I’ve been taking a wide variety of courses, from organic chemistry to biochemistry to physics, and I’m trying my best to keep up with the material. However, most of the content is still new to me, and I feel overwhelmed by what I’m learning. My professor’s been helpful, but I’m also feeling frustrated and uncertain about whether I’m doing something wrong or if I’m just not cut out for this major. I’m currently in a chemistry seminar and am also taking a bioinformatics course, which is adding to my load. I’m worried that I’m falling behind and will eventually fall behind even more if I keep this up. I’d really appreciate help understanding what I’m doing well in the major, what areas need improvement, and how to stay on track without feeling overwhelmed. I’d also think about exploring other majors or career paths that might be more aligned with my interests and skills.
